org.eclipse.viatra.query.tooling.core.generator.genmodel

Interface IVQGenmodelProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenModelMetamodelProviderService

    public interface IVQGenmodelProvider
    Helper interface for accessing vql genmodels

    • Method Detail

      • getGeneratorModel

        ViatraQueryGeneratorModel getGeneratorModel(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject context)
        Gets the generator model for a selected VIATRA query-related context object (e.g. a Pattern). If the project of the pattern has no generator model specified, this method returns an empty generator model. The genmodel will be placed into the ResourceSet of the Pattern object.
        Parameters:
        pattern -
        Returns:
        the loaded generator model
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter pattern is not serialized into a ResourceSet that is not linked to an VIATRA Query project

      • getGeneratorModel

        ViatraQueryGeneratorModel getGeneratorModel(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project,
                                          org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet set)
        Gets the generator model for a selected Viatra Query project. If the project has no generator model specified, this method returns an empty generator model. The genmodel will be placed into the specified resource set
        Parameters:
        project -
        set -
        Returns:
        the loaded generator model

      • saveGeneratorModel

        void saveGeneratorModel(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project,
                      ViatraQueryGeneratorModel generatorModel)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the changes to the generator model instance in the selected project. The provider assumes that the genmodel was instantiated by using the getGeneratorModel(EObject) or the getGeneratorModel(IProject, ResourceSet) methods.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAllMetamodelObjects

        java.util.Collection<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage> getAllMetamodelObjects(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project)
                                                                            throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
        Collects all EPackage objects available from a selected project, including the ones from the EPackage Registry. If the project features an vqgen files, the packages referenced there are also included.
        Parameters:
        project -
        Returns:
        a non-null collection of packages
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException

      • findGenPackage

        org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.GenPackage findGenPackage(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject context,
                                                               org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage)
        Tries to find the EMF GenPackage for a selected EPackage. The context object is used for determining the actual project.
        Parameters:
        ePackage -
        Returns:
        the corresponding GenPackage for the selected EPackage

      • findGenPackage

        org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.GenPackage findGenPackage(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet set,
                                                               java.lang.String packageNsUri)
        Tries to find the EMF GenPackage for a selected EPackage. The resource set is expected to be the one Xtext assigns for a Java project.
        Parameters:
        packageNsUri -
        Returns:
        the corresponding GenPackage for the selected EPackage

      • findGenPackage

        org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.GenPackage findGenPackage(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet set,
                                                               org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage)
        Tries to find the EMF GenPackage for a selected EPackage. The resource set is expected to be the one Xtext assigns for a Java project.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the corresponding GenPackage for the selected EPackage

      • findGenPackage

        org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.GenPackage findGenPackage(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject ctx,
                                                               java.lang.String packageNsUri)
        Tries to find the EMF GenPackage for a selected EPackage. The context object is used for determining the actual project.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the corresponding GenPackage for the selected EPackage

      • getGeneratorModelPath

        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath getGeneratorModelPath(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project)
        Calculates the path of the generator model from a selected project. If the project has no generator model defined, the method still returns the path where to look for the generator model.
        Parameters:
        project -
        Returns:
        a non-empty path for the generator model. It is possible that no resource exists at this path.
